data.title: Intersection of two rectangles
data.statement:
CunÃ©gonde is working on a graphical application. You are going to help her finding the <<intersection of two rectangles>>.

Rectangles have their sides aligned with either <<X>> or <<Y axis>>. So, they are defined by their two <<top-left>> and <<bottom-right corners>>. Each corner gets two coordinates <<x>> and <<y>> (both <<integers>>).
Notice that the intersection of two rectangles either is a <<Rectangle>> itself, or is {{Empty}}.

If rectangles are only connected by one of their corners or by one of their sides, their intersection is considered to be empty.

The <<x>> coordinates are increasing <<from left to right>>.
The <<y>> coordinates are increasing <<from top to bottom>>.
data.stubGenerator:
read rect1:string(32)
read rect2:string(32)
write Empty
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> four ints seperated by spaces representing resp. [[tl_x]], [[tl_y]], [[br_x]] and [[br_y]]: the coordinates of resp. the <<top-left corner>> then the <<bottom-right corner>> of <<first rectangle>>.
<<Line 2:>> four ints seperated by spaces representing resp. [[tl_x]], [[tl_y]], [[br_x]] and [[br_y]]: the coordinates of resp. the <<top-left corner>> then the <<bottom-right corner>> corner of <<second rectangle>>.
data.outputDescription: Word '{{Empty}}' if rectangles <<do not>> intersect, or a line with four ints seperated by spaces, representing resp. [[tl_x]], [[tl_y]], [[br_x]] and [[br_y]] that describe the intersection rectangle.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Cunégonde is working on a graphical application. You are going to help her finding the intersection of two rectangles.

Rectangles have their sides aligned with either X or Y axis. So, they are defined by their two top-left and bottom-right corners. Each corner gets two coordinates x and y (both integers).
Notice that the intersection of two rectangles either is a Rectangle itself, or is Empty.

If rectangles are only connected by one of their corners or by one of their sides, their intersection is considered to be empty.

The x coordinates are increasing from left to right.
The y coordinates are increasing from top to bottom.
Input
Line 1: four ints seperated by spaces representing resp. tl_x, tl_y, br_x and br_y: the coordinates of resp. the top-left corner then the bottom-right corner of first rectangle.
Line 2: four ints seperated by spaces representing resp. tl_x, tl_y, br_x and br_y: the coordinates of resp. the top-left corner then the bottom-right corner corner of second rectangle.
Output
Word 'Empty' if rectangles do not intersect, or a line with four ints seperated by spaces, representing resp. tl_x, tl_y, br_x and br_y that describe the intersection rectangle.
Constraints
-32768 <= x,y <= 32767
tl_x < br_x
tl_y < br_y
Example
Input
-10 -10 20 10
5 5 30 20
Output
5 5 20 10
